captions.text:
Wait just a minute, let me shoot him just
one last time.
You've had your turn. I want to shot.
No, really I should get to shoot him.
No I want to shoot him, let me.

I was the original and the best, I get to
shoot him.

Thanks to you, Le Chiffre has lost $100 million in
terrorist funding and we now know exactly
where he is going to be.

Excellent, let's go arrest him immediately
then, shall we?

Not yet, in order to recoup his client's money,
he is staging a high stakes poker tournament in Monte Negro.

We want you to go there, play
in the tournament and stop him from winning
back his money.
You want me to play cards against him?
Yes, so that he will lose.
Will the tournament be fixed?

No, you must win fair and square. So play
cards well or we will have funded international terrorism.

I dont understand, we know he's guilty do
we not?
Yes.

Does the poker tournament make him more guilty
or something?

No, but if he loses, he'll be completely desperate
for protection from his creditors.
But isn't he completely out of money now?
Why would we risk him winning this tournament

if it proves nothing and only stands to potentially
give him back his power?

Listen to me, you will go Monte Negro and
play in this poker tournament.

People will most likely try to kill you in
the middle of the game but don't worry because

we're going to give you an extremely expensive car
with a defibrillator in the glove box if your
heart stops beating.

After you win all the money, and Le Chiffre
is scared crazy for his life, he will hold

you hostage and smash your testicles with
a giant rope over and over again to get you

to reveal the password to his once again lost
money.

And then after you continually refuse, he
will suddenly murdered and we will be right
back where we started.
Except for your testicles.

Don't get me wrong, but this sounds like a
horrible idea.
Let's just bring him in to custody now.
Ugh, ok. Fine.
I'll never tell you anything!
You understand me?!?
Never!!
Never going to talk!
You see how boring that was, James?
It's safe now, why are you doing this?

I love you, James! Now I must kill myself
for no reason!
But I killed all the bad guys!
HUGHHHH! Thanks for watching..
Watch some more videos.
Ahhhh. Don't forget to subscribe.
We're on Facebook and Twitter.
Ahh Ok! We'll see you next time!

title: How Casino Royale Should Have Ended

comments.author: Maximus96able

comments.text:
+Tord Brudevoll lol. i like essays. reading them AND writing them. 
actually, if i spent this much time on my comp 150 class as i do here, i'd 
probably have a much better grade in that class XD

i respect your opinion, and it's actually what i said. by taking the bond 
universe in a different direction, it makes the movie appear far better 
than it really is to those who were tired of the overly cheesy gadgety 
movies of the past.

i think this is a real big difference between you and me:

im not a connoisseur of bond movies. ive seen a couple, i checked all them 
out from the library, and they were just some cheesy action movies i 
watched to pass the time during the long summer breaks in my high school 
years. so it's not something i've invested loads of time into (star trek's 
another story, im a total nerd for that shit).

but you, on the other hand, seem to have watched a LOT of bond movies (and 
bond movies are in no shortage. there's what, like, 50 of them?). and i 
think that's where the difference is pronounced. see, you got way used to 
the cheesy gadgety feel, and it seems you even got tired of it. i can 
understand this. i mean, yeah, they did go overboard after a while, doing 
more shit with explosions and gadgets than actual spying. which is why you 
think ANYTHING different makes it better. that i can understand, because 
casino royale is definitely a whole lot of different.

i, on the other hand, am just looking at it as i look at any bond movie. 
just another movie to pass the time. i cant help but make a few outside 
comparisons in addition to comparisons to other bond movies. it seems like 
it was trying to be some sort of bourne thriller, but failed horribly.

honestly, if you're ONLY comparing it to bond movies... then yes, it's a 
good movie. it's one of the better bond movies. its plot still sucks, but 
at least it's trying for once. and at least it's closer to ACTUAL espionage 
than the gadgety nonsense. but i cant help but compare it to every other 
movie i've seen... and it just plain ranks zilch amongst all that. actually 
ALL the bond movies do. and as you said, the only reason i even watch them 
is because im expecting all that cheesy action. it's like watching a horror 
movie or a B movie for me. i was expecting cheesy action, but i got dull 
drama (and not the highest quality dull drama ever).

so i guess i can see why hardcore bond fans see it as one of the greatest 
bond films. im just not one of those hardcore fans.

but you are DEFINITELY right about the difference in actor. i mean, i 
dunno, i think Pierce was prettier, but like you said, at least daniel is 
believable as an actor, which matters more (plus, after so many years, i 
think pierce got a bit of william shatner syndrome going on XD).
comments.author: justme man

comments.text:
I didn't say the only reason you thought it was bad was because it was 
unexpected, just that that was the argument you presented and based your 
judgement of the movie on in previous comments.

Don't get me wrong here, I appreciate a cheesy action movie as much as the 
next guy, I really enjoy a lot of the old Bond movies, Goldeneye and From 
Russia With Love in particular, but I felt at the end of the Pierce Brosnan 
era that they had gone too far in that direction. It was all massive 
explosions, ridiculous gadgets (invisible car anyone?) and oneliners. No 
depth or dialogue to speak of at all.

So when Casino Royale came out I was really happy that they had decided to 
go in a completely different direction. I think the reason we have such 
different opinions on this movie is that I really enjoyed the plot (a few 
obvious holes aside) and the pace of the film, but that is of course purely 
a matter of opinion and personal taste. I also think Daniel Craig's more 
emotionally troubled and flawed Bond is so much more believable (especially 
since the story in this movie is supposed to take place before all the 
other movies), and because I believe in the character I got so much more 
emotionally involved in the film than I have with any of the previous Bond 
films. Previous films were of course not trying to get you emotionally 
involved, they were just trying (and largely succeeding) in being 
entertaining, but personally I prefer a story that I can feel more involved 
in.

I'll agree with you that they might have moved too far in the other 
direction from what it used to be, as you say the movie relies entirely on 
the plotline and the acting, especially because it's too long (I didn't 
think so the first time I saw it but second time it started to drag towards 
the end.) I think the movie could've been made better by speeding up the 
story a bit, there's a lot of content that didn't strictly speaking need to 
be there. So I can see that if you don't enjoy the storyline it can get 
desperately boring. But as I said, I really liked the story, and 
consequently really enjoyed the film. It's also very well produced from a 
technical standpoint, good camera angles and cuts (as opposed to Quantum of 
Solace, which was just unwatchable),and great sound and music.

But anyways, personal opinions and all that jazz, sorry for the essay.
comments.author: Tord Brudevoll

comments.text:
+Tord Brudevoll actually, you put your finger on it. i was expecting 
something, got something else, and so, didnt like it.

but there is more to it than that. look, NO bond movie is "good" by any 
means. they are all mindless action fests with super cheesy plot lines 
(that feel more like an after thought). they're unrealistic and it's not in 
anyway indicative of real espionage (it's not particularly subtle to drive 
a tank straight through Moscow. no spy makes up shit like that as he goes 
along).

but that's kind of what makes it good. the bond series has been around 
practically since the beginning of commercially available TVs. by now, 
they've generated so many cheesy stereotypes, it's much like watching a 
star trek movie. the cheesiness MAKES it fun.

so yeah, casino royale wasnt like that, and that is part of why i didnt 
like it... but it's not ALL of what i didnt like about it. look, i went 
into it with the predisposition that i was going to like it in some way, 
and i actually DID like it at first. at first i was like "oh, well, this is 
a nice break from tradition. it's looking a lot more like a LEGIT espionage 
thriller. i bet it'll turn out good."

so dont get me wrong, i didnt go into watching it with some preconceived 
notion... well, actually, i did, but as soon as it started, i thought i'd 
actually like it better than most bond movies because of the change. so i 
gave it every chance i could.

but i started to fall ASLEEP half way through. seriously, you've gotta have 
SOME action. poker face drama, a car crash, and a couple nut shots arent my 
idea of action. you know those poker games they play on TV like it's some 
sort of sporting event? i found THOSE more interesting.

but of course, i would have found all this riveting or acceptable if it 
were only for one thing: if only it had a good story line. slower paced 
action movies usually make up for it with good writing... this wasnt, and 
it wasnt good for precisely the reasons summarized in this youtube video. 
the plot made no sense and was diabolical compared to the mind numbing 
plots of previous bond movies. it was like the writers were trying too 
hard, like they thought making the plot complicated automatically makes it 
good... nope. if it's complicated, fine. but it at least has to make a bit 
of logical sense.

so that's it. they took out the action (the part of the bond movies that 
made them good), and never successfully added a good story plot to make up 
for it (the lack thereof made the bond movies bad). it's like the retarded 
child resulting from the jason bourne series fucking the james bond series 
in the vajayjay (lol, excuse the explicitness).

so, just as you can say, "the only reason i thought it was bad was because 
it wasnt what i expected" (which, ill admit, is PARTLY true), i can also 
say "the only reason anybody thinks it's GOOD is because it's a complete 
and total break from the traditional bond movie style, and is thus better 
than them in comparison."

but either way, it doesnt matter much what movies i like. i mean, i've 
liked stupid shit before too, so what do i know. apparently oblivion was a 
bad movie, i never noticed XD. there are more important things in life.
comments.author: justme man

comments.text:
+justme man
 I agree with your general point that "everyone loved it" isn't a valid 
argument for whether or not something is good, as, as you say, the masses 
generally love crap, both when it comes to movies and music. I don't 
however agree that Casino Royale was a bad movie. Your argument for calling 
it bad is that it's not at all like all the preceding Bond films, which is 
true, and I think that puts some people off it because it's not what they 
expected to see. But to use that as an argument for calling it a bad movie 
just doesn't hold up. You didn't like it, that's fine, but it's not, by any 
stretch, a badly made film. I personally enjoyed both Casino Royale AND 
Skyfall a LOT more than for example Die Another Day, which was just 
insanulously stupid. At the end of the day it's all a matter of opinion 
though.

Fury: 7.7

(not the worst movie i've ever seen, but still not particularly good. it

than casino royale).

ill tell you what's really irksome though. when bad movies like olympus has 
fallen packs the theaters (yes, sadly, i did go see it) for months on end, 
while good movies like fly boys got empty theaters (seriously? that was a 
good movie, yet i was one of only 4 people in that theater after it came 
out).

and although they have good reviews NOW, how about some of those classics 
that were torn apart by critics? fight club, caddyshack, godfather 2, you 
name it.

so no, i dont think im wrong here, masses love horrible movies and hate 
movies that come to be classics later on. CRITICS espescially are just 
ordinary people, and their opinions are no more valuable than yours or 
mine. why you're trying to use critics as evidence that casino royale is a 
good movie is beyond me.

get lost fan boy, nothing you're going to say is going to convince me 
casino royale is a good movie. it's shit. it's boring, it's tiresome, it's 
like watching grass grow, and it's plot makes no sense whatsoever. why are 
you wasting your time here? i fully expect you and 90% of the other total

... yup.

comments.author: justme man

comments.text:
+Cryer24597 what the hell?... why do random comments like yours get marked 
as spam?

anyway, no, i dont have aweful taste. the movie was out of place.

if you like watching grass grow, fine, it's a good movie. but it shouldnt 
be called a "bond" movie. when you watch a bond movie, you expect to see 
explosions, tanks, thrilling adventure, funky gadgets, or at least the more 
sublime aspects of the cloak and dagger universe. instead, we got drama 
only a poker buff would enjoy. i like playing poker, but watching it is 
like watching golf. i dont suppose your "tastes" involve watching golf too?

bond movies are supposed to be mind numbing action thrillers with cheesy 
plots, that's what you EXPECT when you watch one.

instead we got a plot that was diabolical and makes no logical sense (even 
the stupidest of bond movies make SOME lick of sense). there was hardly any 
action, and the best you got was a car wreck, and a ball whacking scene so 
disgusting, i cant even remember it, i guess because i just blocked it from 
memory (didnt even know there was such a scene till i saw this cheesy 
animation).

this isnt bond. it belongs nowhere in the bond universe.

Solace; it's nothing but a revenge mission. As for this video, I think he 
was worried about his testicles, so he didn't want to go through all the 
unnecessary stuff, even if it would be more interesting.﻿

comments.author: Parsa Hazeri

comments.text:
Like so many of the James Bond stories, this one lost a lot of coherence 
when they took out Communism.
Le Chiffre was originally one of the financiers for a French chapter of the 
Communist party, and he lost a lot of their money in bad investments and 
hoped to win it back. They couldn't arrest him BEFORE because that's how 
the Cold War went; lots of people got away with stuff because both sides 
had bigger fish to fry.﻿
